alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:15PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Thompsonville, Hartford... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding affects some residential areas below Hartford through Rocky Hill, including some roadways. Upstream of Hartford, flooding is likely to affect Windsor Locks, East Windsor and Windsor. Should localized evacuations be necessary, act quickly. Know alternate routes for travel in your location should roads along the river become flooded and impassable. Further downstream flooding increases through Middletown and Portland to Old Saybrook. Some evacuations of low lying areas may be needed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 22.8 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.8 feet on 08/22/1856. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
